intro: Antirrhinum pedunculatum, commonly known as the clustered snapdragon, is a herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It features slender, upright stems that bear clusters of vibrant red or orange tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces showy blooms from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, arranged alternately along the stem. Antirrhinum pedunculatum is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and attracts pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
